event.title: a decrease of 0.9 percent from 3,282 at the 2000

data.event: The 2010 census population was 3,251, a decrease of 0.9 percent from 3,282 at the 2000 census.

event.title: named in honor of then President Grover Cleveland on April 19, 1894

data.event: The post office was then moved 100 feet, and reestablished under the name Cleveland, named in honor of then President Grover Cleveland on April 19, 1894.

In 1904, a railroad line owned by the Missouri, Kansas and Oklahoma Railroad (later known as Missouri, Kansas and Texas Railway or Katy) from Oklahoma City reached Cleveland and crossed the Arkansas River into Osage County.

event.title: May 27, 1904, the first oil well was spudded

data.event: On May 27, 1904, the first oil well was spudded near the community, and it caused an influx of oil workers and other people.
At the time of statehood in 1907, Cleveland had 1,441 residents.
